reason: The clearing of denominators from G_r(z)=G_p(w) to F(w)=r'(z)p(w)-p'(w)r(z)=0 potentially introduces spurious solutions at roots of p(w). The prover should explicitly note that for z in C^+ (where r(z)\!=0 since r has real roots), w=lambda_j is a root of F only if p'(lambda_j)r(z)=0, which is impossible since p has simple roots and r(z)\!=0. This confirms no spurious solutions are introduced. The omission is minor since the conclusion (degree genuinely n, with n solutions) is correct.
